name: Janna Craig
text: I cannot express strongly enough how extremely helpful the folks at PostNet were, going above and beyond to help when my original printer for a work project dropped the ball. I called PostNet at 4:30pm, needing flyers printed by the end of the day and they not only printed them for me, but delivered them to our local clinic (I was several hundred miles away and couldn't pick them up), even though they don't typically offer delivery services. I would use them again in a heartbeat and strongly recommend them to anyone else in the Fairhope area.

name: Trinity Vintage Valencia
text: They offer so many different things.  Super convenient and easy.

name: Hank Goins
text: Great place to work been there for a few years great pay and benefits good equipment and I work with some of the best people anyone could ever ask for

name: Allison Fuller
text: Brought my fence delivery.  Did not have a forklift.  Gentleman was going to leave it at the end of my driveway, blocking my vehicles and the opposite are of where I needed it.   I had him load it back up and I called the fence company and canceled my order.  Super inconvenient.

name: Randy Jones
text: keep getting texts and emails to call and set a delivery time... 7 times of sitting on the phone for almost an hour before getting hung up on..so I tried the "call back feature" last night   NO CALL BACK.. tried calling again today on hold for almost an hour and hung up on me yet again   how the heck do I ever get the delivery?

name: Mark Beeman
text: They DESTROYED a $560 monitor I puchased and I ended up getting a check for $11 after months of dealing with their claims dept.  My only option was small claims court.  STAY AWAY!!

name: Mik S
text:
Do you have driver training ? Like slower traffic keep right ?

I just spent 15 min stuck behind one of your trucks blocking the the left lane the ENTIRE length of 565 at 520pm.

Please help this poor driver from embarrass your company further with your XPO logo on that truck .
He didn't even move over when he had room in the right lane... forcing cars to have to around him.  It was so backed up I couldn't pass him till 565ended .

I would hope XPO would want a better public reflection of their company than this

name: Josh
text: Despite most of the negative reviews, I had no problems with my delivery or pickup from them. I had ordered a new hood for my Mazda and it was shipped fine with no damage.

name: Wayne Thompson
text: Very prompt
they may be ok for shipping steel balls and rubber hammers but if you want to ship something that can be damaged DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY

text: Extremely nice staff, they didn't have what I needed but they pointed me to where I could find it. Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Bob Wangen
text: This Post Office appears to be PERMANENTLY CLOSED. The doors are locked and it is boarded up inside.  Even though the US flag is up, this office does not show up on the USPS locator.

name: Ginger Poling
text: Multiple times a week I will come home to mail on the ground or sticking out of my mailbox and one of my doors on the ground. My mailbox will not even be full and my mail carrier is so careless and lazy to take the time to place it in my mailbox correctly. I have had just about enough! Especially when my mail is on the ground. How do I know I am not missing letters? And to leave my mailbox wide open with a packages sticking out so easily for someone to steal.

name: Hannah Altman
text: Stopped by after the holidays to mail a package. Lady was really nice and helpful. 5 stars!

name: Daniel Sloan
text:
NO LONGER THERE!
Recently received a “sorry we missed you” sticker for a package that required delivery. I drove the next day to the address given on the slip and shown here on Google Maps, but the office is shut down permanently, “for sale” signs up on all windows. But not information on where to go.

name: shyman012
text: Lazy postal workers who don’t bother to do their jobs. Worst example of postal services in America.

name: Todd Bailey
text: Why does this show “open” when the place is boarded up?

name: Kelly Hawkins
text: Rude lady made it difficult purchasing a simple money order offering unsolicited advice.  General Negative, contagious, criminalizing attitude toward law abiding citizens. Multiple negative visits. Recommend & will take all my business elsewhere.

name: Jason Phillips
text: Firstly, I am glad the post office remains open! The new ownership is working very hard to improve everything from customer service to the service offerings to ensure Spanish Fort continues to have convenient postal services. Best of all (for those of us who never have cash) - they now take credit cards!

name: Rachel Rollins
text: I made the mistake of stopping in to over night a package. The old lady got an attitude with me saying it would be 25.50. I didn't care what it cost. She was slow as molasses going down hill. I thought it would be a 5 minute trip. Oh no I spent 30 minutes in there with attitude the entire time. I think they need to teach grandma to be a little bit nicer before she gets her feelings hurt. I won't be back.

name: Arria Blanton
text: I had a tracked package marked as delivered to my address but it was someone else’s package. I hand delivered it to the rightful owner about a mile away. I’ve tried calling the post office twice and the call fails after waiting 20+ minutes. I have no idea where my package is and am having zero success in getting in touch with anyone.

name: Ben Lafargue
text: When trying to set up a P.O. Box I was treated like I was a criminal.  Absolutely the worst place ever.  After a month of trying, I finally gave up on trying to get a P.O. Box here (which was for my LLC) and went to Stapleton, it took me one visit there and less than 15 mins.  If you live in Spanish fort I recommend Stapleton.

name: Laurie Watson McKay
text: My daughter moved out and put in for a change of address. Now all my mail is going to her address. SMH

name: Paula Jordan
text: We have made Spanish Fort and Daphne locations aware of the delivery issues. We have a large covered entrance at our home. They keep dropping off the packages at the edge of our porch where the items can get wet. Just one more step towards our porch would cure the problem but they insist on leaving the packages out in the weather....This is unreal!

name: David Rich
text:
I used this post office in 2013 to send multiple packages of goodies to relatives all over the country and these people were so patience and nice.  I thought they deal with crabby people all day and everyone is sending loved one care packages and presents and everyone is in a hurry, taking it out on the workers that are doing their very best to be friendly and upbeat.  I asked them does anyone ever do anything nice for you at Christmas or any other time of the year and the lady said no but it's okay.  I came home and made up a couple of boxes of homemade treats and told them thank you for your patience and kindness.  They were thrilled.  A couple of days later I received a thank you note from them.  Quality people and quality service.
Brenda Rich

name: Craig Morgan
text: I dropped off my Dad’s Father’s Day card on Wednesday.Handed the lady the proper money for postage plus the card. It got returned to my house nine days later due to no postage on card.

name: Jake Hyman
text: Much better under new operators!

name: Nathan Browning (hrottiridill)
text: On multiple occasions.. Mail from other houses keep getting delivered to our house. Not even delivered to the correct street or even the correct house number.

name: Lexi Inzinia
text: I would give this place a -1 if I could. First of all, the customer service is ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE! There is an older lady (70s-80s) that is extremely rude and not friendly. If you don't want to help people then help the rest of the community out and retire. Secondly, who does not take credit cards in 2016? Seriously?! How can you not accept credit cards? Not everyone walks around with cash in their pockets. And lastly, I tried to ship a package for next day delivery and was told they can not ship next day! Are you f-ing kidding me?!?! I was told I had to go to the Daphne post office. I told her no, I'm not going to the Daphne Post Office. I'll just take my business to UPS. UPS was shocked when I told them that the Spanish Fort Post Office could not mail my package and he was very friendly and helpful. My suggestion...go to UPS in Daphne. Spend the extra few bucks to ship from a place that actually wants your business. Spanish Fort Post Office is a joke and serves absolutely no purpose. I will tell everyone I know NOT to use them.

name: Julie Brown
text:
i have to avoid this post office because I cannot stand the older lady that works there.  She is stuck in the past and quite proud of it.  I kid you not, she smiled when she said they accept checks and cash only when all I had on me was a debit card and was upset because I needed to get a package out that day.
They close early, as well.  Doors are locked five minutes before the posted closing time.
Honestly, I wouldn't mind the cash/check only policy they have if that were the only negative thing about this place.  Unfortunately, the staff is rude and they close early.  Too many reasons to avoid this place.

name: Matthew Kimble
text: Dropped off wedding invitations on a Thursday at around noon. The drop box out front reads that the pickup time is 4:30, so I assume the deal is done. I check in with guests on Tuesday about RSVPing, and none of them have received invites. I start to panic as these were mailed later than we wanted due to outside circumstances, and guests had a week and a half to RSVP. This post office doesn't have a phone number, I'm pretty sure they don't have a phone at all. I drive down there to ask the owners who get a little defensive when I ask them about the letters, and due to the fact that letters don't have tracking they can't tell me where they are (which isn't their fault). The Monday following the weekend was a federal holiday, for context. The invitations began to finally arrive a week later, on Thursday. Guests informed me that they were not postmarked until two days prior (Tuesday). Two full days went by before they went out, and due to the track record of this place I'm more inclined to believe they sat on a shelf inside until they felt like mailing them. I will never mail from this location again.

name: Sher's Cars
text: This place is closed.

name: Allen Grimes
text:
The poorest excuse of a Post Office and the rudest employees I have ever met in my life! I mean, these women (not ladies) are nothing but walking snobby pieces of...  you get the point. We dropped off a package and it was never scanned in. Customer never received it either.
When I go in to ask the response was, "Oh well."..........
"Seriously?!? Oh, well?!?" I ask in a state of disbelief. "There was $500 worth of items in that box and I put it in your bin. You never scanned it."
" Next time use FedEx." The wrinkly old lady said while pointing her knobby finger toward the road. The lady behind her was smirking and making wierd giggling noises during the entirety of this conversation.
I cannot believe they still have jobs. It is not everyone else's fault they have had such poor lives and are miserable. They are always rude. Everytime I go in for any reason. I can deal with the fact they dont take credit cards, which, let's be honest, old lady time back there is still using up her WW2 sugar rations at Delchamps and has no clue what a credit/debit card is. I'm sure they give their grandkids (Hopefully for children across the world these women dont have any) $2 and tell them not to spend it all in one place and put NECCO wafers in their stockings with a good old fashion fruit cake bar. Maybe even socks if they're lucky.
Listen everyone has bad days but this is every single time. Either to me, my wife, my neighbors, or all the other people putting up reviews.
So, I am going to go in there constantly and make their lives even more miserable. Asking stupid questions, talking extremely slow, paying for everything with dimes and nickels, praising Barack Obama and anything else I think will make them hate me more. Lol, I'm going to enjoy every minute I'm in there. They want me to go to FEDEX? Heck no, I love you ladies so much, I'll be coming in even more now!

name: Richard Cobb
text: World’s worst post office, how they are still open is baffling... they lost a package and when I came in to find out what happened to it with the tracking number and history all they told me is that they didn’t know where to look for it and good luck finding it on my own

name: C Miller
text: Worst post office in the US. I get a portion of my mail, go weeks with no mail, have 1/2 the community’s mail stuffed in my box, or have packages lost. Once you complain, it might get slightly better for a week or two and then it’s back to being worthless. It’s also iffy if I send outgoing mail. Many times that gets lost too.

name: Sherryle Givens
text: Waiting on mailed prescriptions for nearly a month only to find out they claim to have "attempted delivery"  2 days after Christmas but were unable, but we were home all day that day.   No pink slip left in mailbox.  Finally tracked it (sender had tracking number) and find there's no local phone number on website to contact this office directly.  So I'm having to schedule pick up through automated phone to this 800 number.   This is incredulous to me that carrier didn't leave pink slip nor attempt redelivery.   I have never......

name: James Gunnells
text:
Personally, they have never lost a package, letter or anything I have sent through them. On the other hand, I live in Daphne and the regular mail carrier is great, BUT I am having more and more things I put in my mailbox disappear.
Not the friendliest people I've ever met, but they all get the job done. It is a small space that they work in, and that's not their fault. There's a larger PO less that 10 miles away if you need space. One lady is occasionally kinda rude but saves me over $1.00 on every package I bring in because the amount I get off the USPS web site is always too much.
My brother worked for the USPS for over 25 years and I know that most of the problems with the USPS are not with the people that actually handle the mail. People naturally get grouchy when they have to cover someone else's @&&, and I am the only person I know that has never made a mistake.

name: Erin T
text: Wanna talk backwoods podunk? I got a handwritten receipt that just had the recipients name, the cost h the word priority. The box was then covered in $30 in nascar stamps. I cant. It's so outdated here. They dont even take credit cards

name: Rosemary Fisher
text: Wish I could give it less than 1 star!  We MUST get a new post office with updated computer systems, the ability to take credit cards, a Kiosk and a larger facility for the growth of this community.  The little old lady was so sweet, but when she started to use her little calculator and give me wrong information on signature confirmation along with Priority Mail, it was too risky to proceed with my transaction.  I excused myself and took my mail back graciously and drove 7 miles out of my way to get the job done.  I now have to go to Daphne which is a big inconvenience.  Tried contacting the US Government Post Office site to ask for a new post office and the location is not even listed to file a request. Really???   We need to get a petition together in this area for this to change, because it is needed desperately with the growth and need of this community.

name: Jail Bird
text: Went in to make a change of address. Had to wait in line 30 mins before one of the ladies in the back was asked to help. I've never done an address change before so I was asking a lot of questions and the clerk was inexcusably rude. She kept answering me as if I was stupid and didn't want to give me the form to do what I needed. If I could rate less than one I would. This store desperately needs new staff who will actually help customers. Mail is serious and they act like customers are annoyances.

name: Taylor Dellacer
text: I wouldn’t rate them a star but had to pick one. Doesn’t accept debit /credit cards. Won’t allow you to pick up samehousehold/ family members mail if you aren’t 21. Old /run down building, and doesn’t accept packages from fed-ex or ups. Go to the one in daphne.

name: Roman N.
text: They won't accept debit/credit cards...still 80s there.

name: Ellen Erwin
text: Aweful service!!!!! There is an older lady there that is very rude and obviously just wants to get the customer in and out as quickly as possible. I asked if they had a regular envelope to send a valentines card my son made to his grandma. She said no all she had was a priority envelope. I told her that I did not need to send it priority. She said its ok, thats all I have. Well, that led me to believe that she was not gonna charge me the priority prices. My mistake, I guess. When she rang me up, it cost over 5.00 to send a card to my sons grandma! I could have made an ordeal out of it, but i had a long line behind me. I think the lady could have told me what she was doing. I would have went across the street to Rite-Aide and bought a whole box of envelopes. They are not very helpful and very rude.

name: Asher Fowler
text: i hate this post office old lady is mean

name: Kannice Rogers
text: Very rude place the real old lady is rude and if I can help it I will never return!! I rather drive to Daphne or mobile!! If I could rate negative I woild!!

name: Jason Patton
text: Rude before we even got to the counter.

name: Shannon Nichols
text: Does not accept credit or debit cards.

name: Monica French
text: I really wish they would except debit cards

name: Katie Guthrie
text: Rude. And they lost my package after they told me to put it in the black bin up front.

name: Brandi Jackson
text: Accepts cash only.

name: Henry Barron
text: Small and old

name: Paula James
text: Great service didn't have a box and was able to get one here of all places.

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

name: Madison Northrup
text: Awesome and very friendly service! We use the shipping service there during their busiest time and they were very friendly and quick! Highly recommend using this business as shipping rather then the post office or any other choice.

name: Jason Dowling
text: Great atmosphere, shipping in the back. Sandwiches in the front, who could ask for much more? ✌️

name: Kayla Priestley
text: I sometimes go here to return Amazon purchases. They are always so helpful and friendly. For the first time I sat down and had lunch there. It was such a nice, comfortable dining experience even though I had a bunch of kids with me! They were very kind and accommodating. The chef salad was fresh, healthy and delicious. I can't wait to eat here again!

name: Henry Robertson
text: It's in the back of an old store with wooden flooring, attached to a coffee shop.  They took care of me quickly, great atmosphere to pick up a sandwich too.

name: Champ Ion
text: EXCELLENT Customer service. UPS drop off point.

name: Linda Ford
text: These people are SUPER SMART at what they do and it is busy ALL THE TIME. Amazon makes doing a return dang near impossible, but these guys figured it out. GREAT PLACE!! VERY FRIENDLY! !!

name: jonathan crump
text: These folks are always so helpful!  Thanks so much!

name: Jesse Martin
text: FedEx has been constantly dropping my packages at the wrong address and now they have lost my phone I recently ordered. Now I have to go through this long process of contacting where I ordered it from and filing a police report just to try and get another one or my money back. If you have a choice don't use FedEx or at least not this FedEx.

name: Cecil Brown
text: Wonderful customer service !

name: Dale Miller
text: Good for package shipping

name: daniel reuben
text: Very friendly I would go there again 😊

name: Lee Austin
text: Very helpful.

name: Patrick Sims
text: Debbie is the best!

name: Billy Thomason
text: Small area of actual antiques

name: Jeremy Gossett
text: FedEx and UPS Authorized Shipping Center.

name: James “XDMAN” Nicholas
text: If I absolutely need office supplies right now and cant order them online I will go here. The place is usually quite and empty for the most part so it is easy to get help from any of the employees. A plus is that they can make custom stamps for say and address while you wait.

name: Bryan Thompson
text: I tried sending a package through them and an employee was taking up the space for personal use on what appeared to be company time. I then showed them the QR code that they're supposed to be able to scan to print out a label. They didn't even know how to do that. The box I had needed to be taped so I asked if they could tape it. Not only did the employee only put a single, small piece of tape on it, but he didn't even know how to use the tape gun. I had to do it. Being the only person in line, it took me 15 minutes to get a label printed and box taped up.

name: Ashley Robinson
text: BOO! Equipment was all broken and employees didn't care. I waited FOREVER for my VERY important fax to send. When it finally failed they just shrugged and laughed. I had to leave. Signs were posted everywhere about malfuctioning equipment...it seems disfunction is the norm there. Boo.

name: Casey Sugden
text: The store is stocked full of all your office, school, and home essentials. Had no problem finding what I needed at good prices. Office Depot has a great inventory and a staff that is willing to help.

name: jennifer kyle
text: Great . Wonderful people work there. Best service.

name: Shelley Potter
text: I have done 2 different print orders there, and I will likely not go there again for a print order. Both times the order was marked as complete, and when I arrived I had to wait on them to fix it because there were mistakes.

name: Tarrie Love
text: Their staff is the best. I had designed an invitation, and was having trouble locating an envelope that would fit. name: Brooke McIntire
text: I have had packages delivered to the wrong address and disappear into thin air so many times in the Shoals when UPS is the courier. This last issue takes the cake though. On Thursday night, my insulin pump stopped working. I called the manufacturer and they immediately overnighted a replacement using UPS. First the said package was supposedly left off the plane in Louisville, KY. This added a full day to the delivery. Then, the next day, it arrived in Muscle Shoals and was put on the vehicle and marked “out for delivery” at 7:04am. At a few minutes past 7pm, the status changed back to “In Transit”. I called customer service and even after escalating was told no one would answer them at the Muscle Shoals distribution center and the LIFE OR DEATH package that was supposed to be here Friday now won’t be here before Monday. Hopefully they won’t be delivering the device that keeps me alive to my grieving family on Monday.

text: Took my computer into this store. Talked to an extremely nice gentleman named Robert. Little did I know that he was about to try and screw me out of a ton of money! I left my computer there for a "free" check up. When I came back two days later, this guy had just deleted all my stuff off the computer. It had a virus and if I wanted to wipe all the stuff off the thing I could have done that myself. He then tells me that I owe Office Depot $240 for the work. And then stuck his hand out like I was going to give the cash to him! So now I have lost all my stuff off my computer. If you don't want to waste your time and money don't take your computer here.

text: Ok so they messed up my computer and now no antivirus program will work on it. It's been a week now. Yesterday they said that they have absolutely no idea what's going on with it and that they were going to take it to another office Depot location to let them have a look. I call the other location a little while ago and the tech guy tells me he doesn't know what I'm talking about because he didn't work yesterday when my computer was to be taken to them. Anyways he's supposed to be checking it out and getting back up with me. I'm hoping they figure something out. On the plus side they are really nice people and seem to be taking responsibility so I gave them 2 stars.

name: Kermit Frogg
text:
For  3 days I have been checking the status of a package I am expecting from UPS.   For each of those 3 days I was informed the package is 'out for delivery'.

Since I thought it was important for me to be present when the item was delivered, I have devoted 11 hours a day (9AM to 8PM) waiting at home for it. Still no package.

Now I've got a weekend forthcoming.  So that means I may receive the package 6 days, at the earliest, since I received the first ''out for delivery' notification.

I'm very disappointed.

I then was given a 3-day window for delivery.  It never came.

I then was informed "It's out for delivery pm 21 July.

So I've been waiting for 3 days and still no package.  Since I thought it was important that I be home for the delivery, I decided to wait for the delivery. I have been waiting for it from 0900 to 2000, or 11 hours each day. That's a total of 33 hours I have been stranded in my home.

name: z k
text:
Avoid for custom card printing services! Staff are friendly and responsive,  but it seems they have no experience or training in using any of their computer software ... even the resident "graphic artist". The graphic artist wasn't attentive at all to the clear descriptions I had in my email for what I wanted, and it seems the computer itself may be unable to handle the graphics software requirements.

After emailing my images and card descriptions, and feeling very positive about the response I received, I arrived to check on the test prints. They were terrible. The original image had been completely changed - apparently a misunderstanding from the email, but I can't see how someone could interpret it so wildly different. I said nothing about changing my own images.

I had a secondary image I wanted on the back of the card, and for some reason the staff stretched the image out of shape and also completely redid the text in the image for no reason. Let me be clear that the image was a jpg format so, to redo the text, the staff had to take it upon themselves to either cut it out from the image and warp it into its new position, or plaster new text on top of it and resave as a new jpg - not at all a simple, trivial mistake. I mentioned this as I watched the staff work with it at the computer, and it was clear they didn't know what "aspect ratio" was, or how to resize anything to maintain the aspect ratio, and they also kept working with the bad version they'd redone, instead of the original one I wanted.

It seems the only print software they "know" how to use is the standard Windows photo printing interface. If you've ever used this yourself, you know it's as simplistic as you can get and not the best software for sizing and placing images exactly where you want them, unless you know what you're doing. The staff did not know what they were doing, even to print the right things on the right sides of the paper. And this was the software they wanted to use to size and place images on paper to create my card. What kind of professional printing service uses the barebones Windows software to print ANYTHING??? This is not creative software! This isn't even appropriate printing software unless you're desperate or want only the most simplistic results. Utterly embarrassing.

After several minutes of watching the staff stretch and squeeze my image in one program, fail to print at the right size via Windows print, and then try to open up another program supposedly to edit further (and fail because the computer simply wasn't going to open the program), I decided I could do better at home. I also learned that even though the staff said I could provide the text for the inside of the card and they would pick the font and arrange it for me (as you do when you're a print shop), this is an extra charge of something like $10. I was told that if I wanted to save that extra charge, I needed to format the words and everything myself and save it as an image, so the sum total of their responsibility would be printing images and not messing with text. I was also told that if they had to resize any of the images (like they were trying and failing to do) that was also a charge of $10. What graphic artistry does that entail? Who knows. Resizing images is also par for the course for printing cards, and should be free, along with arranging text. But it's not, so YOU need to do all the leg work by making sure your images are the "right size" for printing ahead of time. That's right, your jpg on the computer must be sized at 5 inches ahead of time, by yourself, to print on a 5 inch card. Nevermind that the print shop is in the best position to actually control the physical print size and all you should need to do is send a high quality image.

Paper choices are run-of-the mill and nothing special. Will never print anything here for any reason.

To be clear, I don't blame the staff; they did their best. I blame the owners. Train your people. You let them and your customers down.

resp.text: My name is John hasan and as the owner of this small business, this is not what I like to hear at all. I sincerely apologize you had a poor experience. Please know that I am taking your feedback to heart and plan to provide ongoing training for our staff to increase our print expertise. I hope we have the opportunity to make it up to you in the future.

text:
Left huge package in the grass beside the gate. In bad weather. I’m not wimpy by any means but I will probably pay for moving it by myself. I would understand if other options were not available, we do have dogs. But, USPS and Fedex and yep even UPS have been putting packages in my old SUV for over a year now. I did check on my delivery notification to see who delivered it before I did this review. Wanted to do two and a half stars since it being delivered made it halfway right, but that isn’t an option. Since I’m still hurting down my side pretty good and the box has a hole in it, (which could have been done while not with UPS), I couldn’t bring myself to do three full stars. I would have just called to complain but apparently they don’t open till the afternoon.

Update:  dropped from two stars to one. About a month ago they left a mattress that I ordered from Amazon in Heavy Rain!! Are you kidding me? If it hadn’t been wrapped in plastic inside the box I would have went down there and explained how they would be returning it for me and buying me a new one. I mean this is just beyond unacceptable. I waited over a month before updating my review so that I could calm down about it some.

name: Kris Nowka
text:
Customer service at this drop off location - GREAT.  UPS Delivery out of this location - VERY FRUSTRATING.

Example:  At Christmas we were ALL home ALL day.  Lights on and doors open in the house.  UPS delivery person leaves sticker on door inside garage rather than ringing door bell for us to sign for package.  We signed the sticker authorizing them to drop it off.  The next day, we were all home again, garage door completely open, lights on.  This time they came to the FRONT door, did not ring the bell and left another sticker there.

February - They left a sticker on the door for a package that required a signature.  We signed it and put it back on the SAME door.  Next day, I was home but still left the sticker on the FRONT door.  The garage door was raised ~24 inches for the dog to come in and out.  The driver crawled under the garage door and left another sticker on the house door inside the garage.  The signed sticker is still on the FRONT door.

text:
I’ve been waiting on a package for a week and when it’s supposed to be delivered the driver states that the address is wrong. The driver is wrong. My wife saw the UPS truck pull in front of our house, then leave with no attempt to deliver the package. The address is the same as it’s always been for years. I called to let customer service know that the address was correct and asked if the drive could call me and I was help them find my house or meet them to get may package which I need very badly. I waited for a phone call that I was told I would receive before 8pm while waiting at the front window of the house so I would see truck if it passed. I never received the call. At 9pm I received a notification saying that the package couldn’t be delivered because a signature was required and that the delivery is rescheduled for the following week. The driver was in the wrong here again too be cause the drive never came back to the house. Like I said earlier, I was waiting and never saw or heard anyone. There was NO note for a delivery attempt. I even checked my cameras to find that no one stoped by. Now because of a drivers negligence, I’m losing money on a job that I am unable to perform due to the part that was supposed to be delivered. I’m losing way more money than what it will take to pay the drive overtime and fuel to drive out here again.

This is very poor business.

text: I got a delivery notification after 1 yesterday saying package left at front door. I got home from work and saw no package. I went down the street to a house that has the same address except they are SE to my NE, we get each other's mail all the time, but they didn't have the package. At this point I figured it got stolen off my front porch until this morning when my next door neighbor carried over the saddest looking package I've ever seen. You see, it rained all evening and night last night - and my package was not only delivered to the WRONG house, but was left on an uncovered front stoop when it was very obvious that it was going to rain. Overlooking the fact that they delivered to the wrong house, that house had a carport they could have left the package under, and with it being the holidays and people stealing packages being a common occurrence, leaving any packages out in the open like that when there's the option of a carport is ridiculous. Lazy delivering by people who obviously can't be bothered to do their job. I understand there's a good chance it was a seasonal worker but there's no excuse. Very friendly staff and we didn't have to wait long at all, on all 3 trips!

This was the worst experience I think I've ever had in a store. The staff was horrible. I asked a simple question and the guy said I'll go get it from the back. I sat at the front for 45 minutes. Not only that but the girl at the online pickup/print area literally cussed out a customer. He left. Not to mention how messy and dirty the place is.

resp.text:
Hi Patricia:

Thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback. I am so sorry to hear we let you down. This is not the experience we want for our customers. We will research this immediately.

Would you please be so kind to send an email to socialmedia.service@officedepot.com with your best contact email and phone number, and a short recap similar to below? Please include the store #2564 in the subject line.

Chloe :)

name: Stephanie Mims
text: Last 2 times I been in this store, staff was non existent. Couldn’t find anybody to help. Finally found one guy that didn’t offer that much help or knowledge. Went back in to return an item and cashier had an attitude for no reason. Store was messy and disorganized. Went down to Staples and had an awesome experience. Also spent $200+ there. So sorry about y’all’s luck. I won’t be back to this location.

resp.text: Hello Stephanie,  Thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback. I am so sorry to hear we let you down. This is not the experience we want our Customers to have and we want to investigate this immediately. I have sent this to the Field Management Team responsible for the store's location. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention.  Leesa

name: BJ Winston
text: This store needs more workers and ones who actually service all customers and not those of their same skin tone. Waited an hour for assistance. Found what I needed but no one was around to help except for the guy who went from the the counter to every other customer except me. Ordered the product online, finally ask for help again only to be told that the display could not be sold.

name: Shawna L.
text: Five Stars to Tech Services Rep *Will*. He was extremely patient in helping me with issues with my desktop (White Dell AIO). His advise, skillset and overall mannerism was the epitome of customer service. Thank you Will !

name: Ashley Wright
text: Went into store to buy two computer chairs for our household. We found the ones that we wanted at the price point we wanted. No one seemed to be available to help us, so we had to load them up ourselves. Once reaching the register, the chairs rang up $100+ higher than the signage. Even after verifying the price tag did indeed show the lower price, we were (rudely) told that since the sale had ended (6 days earlier, btw), they would not honor their price tags. Either update your signage when the sale ends, or learn something about customer service and own up to your mistakes. I've worked in retail before, and this is not how you treat customers.

resp.text: Hi Ashley, Thank you for bringing this Customer service issue to our attention. I am so sorry for the negative experience you recently had at our store. I would like to send your comments to the appropriate team, so that this can be addressed properly. They will want to contact you for additional details. Kindly send us an email to socialmedia.service@officedepot.com. Please provide the store # in the subject line along with your contact information and these details. We are here to help! -Emma

name: Brandi Westrom
text: I ordered a printer to be delivered.  Shipping confirmation stated that I would receive the printer on 8/10/20.  I received another shipping communication after the printer was not delivered stating that the printer was not on the truck but delivery would be attempted again.  I contacted customer service and found out that I would have to reorder the printer to actually get it.  The email said nothing about needing to reorder!!!!   It is no wonder Amazon is doing so well.

resp.text:
Hi Brandi:

Thank you for taking the time to provide us your feedback. I am so sorry to hear we let you down. This is not the experience we want for our customers. We will research this immediately.

Chloe :)

name: Carl Esch
text: I gave a 5, STAR review on this sight. HOW EVER this time when we went to pick up our new batch of Business Cards for our Band, they was not as well made as the original was. I gave the Lady at the desk one of out old cards told her to duplicate it. She said Very well. We ordered two boxes. When I picked them up they was off centered to the Left cutting My wife's right shoulder and part of her hat off. The lettering was so darn small and light colored we could see it with a magnifier glass. But when you hand a card to a Potential Client, you want them to be able to read it easily. If they have to strain they will chunk it. I cut the rating down to a 3 star. If it is no better I will cut it out all to gather. They have always been good there is why we went back.

name: kevin nguyen
text: I went here to get my business gift certificate done. i gave them a copy of my old gift certificate and tell them that how i want, when i pick up and take it home until my boss take a look, he was so up set how poor and ugly it look, I regret that I didn’t look before take it home. I never come here again, staple is the best place to go

resp.text: Hi Kevin, Thank you for bringing this Customer service issue to our attention. I am so sorry for the negative experience you recently had at our store. Kindly send us an email to socialmedia.service@officedepot.com. Please provide the store # in the subject line along with your contact information. We are here to help!   Emma

name: Dokter Xomby
text: If I could rate zero stars, I would. Ordered a computer for curbside pickup, they assured me on the website and when called they had one in stock, but they didnt even have one. I drove from an hour away to be told they dont know what I'm talking about. I spent $566.74 and $10 in gas to be turned right back around. They were rude and kept avoiding me because it was 30 minutes before closing time. Now I have to wait 3 days to be refunded my money. I will never be doing business at this store again. Better off going to your local Goodwill or Walmart for a computer than this Office Depot. Horrible experience!

name: Amy Gilmer
text: It's an older store, but it's well organized and clean. Employees were all friendly and helpful. I did an online print order and one item was wrong. The employee at the print center fixed it immediately and everything turned out great.

name: Amber Puckett
text: I love shopping at this store. I do a lot of personal and business transactions at this store. The staff always makes me feel at home and part of the family.

name: Donna Stamper
text: I appreciate the Office Depot staff walking 20 feet to the ink section to retrieve the single black cartridge I ordered online. Apparently, the online ordering process is only convenient if the item you're ordering is not actually in the store and you need it to be.  Otherwise, you will spend just as much time, if not longer, standing at the online pickup counter trying to pick up the item you searched and already paid for online.  Office Depot scanned my driver license (I had already clarified that I personally would pick up the order, as the online form asks). I was asked twice if I wanted a receipt, once by the computer then by the rep (the receipt already came to my email,  along with the $ withdrawn from my account when I placed the order).  I had to sign the credit card panel.  Honestly, I don't have to do all that when I order $200 worth of groceries online for pickup at Walmart.  Office Depot--please make your online ordering more efficient.  Isn't that the point of ordering online--efficiency and convenience?

name: CC
text: I ordered a poster print at 11:47 am because I needed for a trip I'm taking tomorrow and they claim to provide same day service. They said it would be ready by 7 pm. That gave them 7+ hours to have it done. When I came to pick it up 7pm, the guy behind the counter said, "Yeah, I haven't even started it yet." No apology. When I got upset he asked when I needed it. I said, now. You had 7+ hours to get it ready! I won't being doing any business here again!

resp.text:
Colleen, , I am sorry to learn that you were disappointed with the service you received during a recent visit to your local Office Depot store.  When you enter one of our stores you are our guest, and as such are entitled to be greeted by knowledgeable employees who are willing and eager to assist you.  From your comments, it appears that this is not the level of service that you received, and we regret disappointing you.
""If you would like I can place a note for someone to contact you back after they receive the complaint, would this be okay?" If you would reply back to SocialMedia.Service@OfficeDepot.com . Please enter the store#2645 in the subject line.  Thanks  Shirley!

name: S.Hazen Guthrie
text:
I have had two copying crises.  Not a normal Office Depot customer, I followed a suggestion to try  a particular Office Depot store in my city:  University Drive, Huntsville Alabama.

Customer service by the copy specialist, Katie, was just amazing.  There was no job too unusual, time limit too constraining.  She was creative, competent, and fast.  The second occasion, I was helped by the manager, Gary.  He set me up with the copy center.  Once again creativity, confidence, and service.

As an individual businessperson, my crazy schedule and over-full priority list were made so much easier today.

Thank you!!!

name: Paulette Risher
text:
Yesterday, I purchased a 27" Samsung Computer Monitor.  I installed it and was extremely unhappy with the quality of the color and resolution.

Only then did I go back and read the reviews on the Office Depot website and found that I wasn't alone in my negative assessment.  I called the store and the customer service manager could not have been more accommodating.  There was no whining or critique.  He simply told me to bring it back and they would give me a refund or trade it for another monitor.  This morning I took it back in and the man that helped me could not have been more helpful.  I bought a Dell (one with great reviews).

This is a true example of what excellent customer service looks like.  Thank you!!!

name: Justin Mullen
text: Very disappointing customer service. Came in to pick up extra  mechanical pencils and note cards while in the area and went to the check out.  No one was running the registers, but three employees were behind customer service (2 high school/early college age male and female, as well as a older female)  The two young employees were actively engaged in a conversation, one makes eye contact while the other has back turned but continues with conversation.  The older female notices me as well and has to tell the younger female with her back 4 times to return to her register.  She goes to register, doesn't greet me or ask if I found everything alright.  Instead only asks if I want to sign up for a membership a few times after I decline repeatedly.  She puts my order in the bag and walks off before I can take my card out of the chip reader and back into my wallet.  Didn't even get a thank you for shopping.  Will not return again since staff doesn't want to make their customers feel welcomed or care if they make the sell. Will just order supplies from Amazon in advance, or go to Walmart in a pinch.  At least then I can use self check out.

name: Gwen Thomas
text:
I go to the copy department to get a couple of sheets enlarged. It will be ready in 10 minutes the employee says. I leave and come back in 30 minutes. There is a new lady behind the counter now!! Asking me all kids of questions because the first employee didn't do her job.
So frustrating!! So now I still have to wait.

name: Mattea Matthews
text: Placed an online print order and called to see if it really was going to be ready at 7pm or if I could get it earlier. When I got transferred to their department the girl answered "Printing" I told her about my order and was told "If it said 7pm then it will be ready at 7pm"  then she asked if that was all I needed because she was busy. If ya hate your job that much go find a new one. If management reads this (I really hope you do) if your staff is too overworked and can't keep up with orders than put more staff on and if not then talk to them about customer service. I wont be ordering here again.

name: john morton
text: Friendly staff. Nice set up of products.

name: James Burton
text:
Always available to help. (5 star)

Update Dec 2016 (dropping to 2 star): went by on a Saturday and they were closed by 6:30 even though their sign says they're open till 9. The agent on the phone kept insisting their hours were listed as until 6, and i think he was only satisfied when I read him the hours sign that they really were listed as open until 9.

Update Jan 2017 (dropping to 1 star): I contacted the company about the incident above, and they forwarded my message to the local manager but I have not heard anything after several days. Seems like they should want to fix this. . .

name: Joseph Chandler
text: This is the 2nd time over the years we've bought a new computer from this Office Depot. They actually have really good prices a wide selection of computers both online and in store, and they are friendly and don't push anything you don't need.

name: A Shirey
text: Awesome customer service... Oh did I mention their backpacks are 60% off - don't forget to check out all the Office Furniture upon ur visit and ask for Apollo Furniture assembly service

name: Dark Hatter
text: Miss Talitha, who works in the copy/print section is amazing.  She is extremely helpful and goes out of her way to help how she can. Someone please PROMOTE her!

name: Constance Tiller
text: Always friendly service. I found some great deals today!

name: youknowit158
text: Walked in to look at chairs for a home office. Now it had been open for 2 hours by the time I walked in, and there was trash all over the floor looks like they haven't clean that place in months. And with the horrible lighting of the place and garbage all over the floor and when I mean garbage I mean candy wrappers pieces of plastic receipts and random other things of trash this place just seemed disgusting in the lack of acknowledging my existence by the employees this place gets one star because there's no option for zero Stars. Myself and one other person were the only customers in the entire store literally the employees had us out number 2 to 1. And no one could even say welcome or even clean that place very lazy employees from what I've seen. I can safely say I will never go back to that place.

name: Emilee Vinton
text: Literally the WORST place EVER! Drive AWAY Drive Away FAST! Go anywhere else! I don’t even know why I keep coming back. Every time I go there to get print work done, they forget about my order and when I go to pick it up they never know what I’m talking about. I even go in an place my order in person every time and they still manage to not do their job! It’s ridiculous and then they expect you to pay full price for a huge inconvenience!!! I needed invites printed out recently and needed to mail them on a certain day. I told the lady she was like sure no problem. It will be ready at such and such time. Keep in mind I have a toddler in which it’s hard enough to make time to run errands. I go in with my toddler to pick up my order and I’m actually an hour later than what she told me because I figured they could use the extra hour.  Well when I get there, they had no idea what I was talking about and said the lady never put my order in. My stuff that I wrote down for her along with my usb drive is missing too. My toddler isn’t happy at this point and neither am I! Finally they find it and he said oh yea it’s not done sorry. I can have it done in like a few hours..... I was like well that’s not very helpful bc I needed them mailed today and he said yes I’m sorry. Okay well do you expect me to pay full price bc I sure as heck am not!!!!! Like don’t go here if you want things done right! This is seriously the worst place to go! I wouldn’t even give them a 1

name: John Belt
text: The really tall skinny guy was very helpful and very friendly. I'm sorry I don't know his name.

name: Ashley Fountaine
text: I found the other Office Depot location (at around Drake and Memorial) to be more helpful. The University location had my item "in stock" but they couldn't locate them. They had it marked on sale and it wasn't, according to the manager. So, I visited the other location and they honored the sale even though this location is the one that messed up and left their sign up.

name: Rosemary Davidson
text: Great customer service. They scan my documents for me, and had some great clearance items for the Teachers.

name: Cynthia Riddle
text: The staff was very friendly and helpful.

name: Lee Mills
text: The folks were nice but everything I needed was out of stock.

name: David Brewer
text: Friendly personnel and a great sale.

name: Kayci Williams
text: Called to get a quote to see how much a repair was. Got put on hold then they hung up.

name: Michael Pukish
text: I got help in the aisles from a salesperson without having to ask, and that's everything these days because it's so rare now.

text: They had everything we needed

name: Scott Smith
text: I can really had a hard time finding an Android USB mini charge cable everything you have it's for an iPhone right.

name: annette bramblett
text: Customer rep didn't know what steno pads were (showing my age lol), but we found them. Manager checked me out so there would be no waiting.

name: Robert Kemper
text: Lots of selection except in the telephone area. Couldn't find what I needed.

name: AnnMarie Martin
text: Great customer service!

name: Pat Stolz
text: Hard to find someone to help find an item and then only had one of something i was looking for, but the south store had 5 in stock.

name: Arthur Arthur
text: Customer service by the Computers specialist, Stefan, was just wonderful.

name: Sabrina Faer
text: Great service!

name: AnnMarie Martin
text: Great customer service!

name: Arthur Arthur
text: Customer service by the Computers specialist, Stefan, was just wonderful.

name: Project Hexx
text: Great Service Manager name Cliff

name: Mandy Hunter
text: I typically do not write reviews about service, but the customer service with this company is TERRIBLE!!  We order items for insureds who have lost stuff in fires, hurricanes, thefts, etc.  XPO Logistics called our office about setting up a delivery of Serta mattress (we ordered from Sam's Club).  We gave them the insured phone # and told them that it would be best to call them directly.  They called us back 4 different times asking the same info.  I contacted them and looks like EVERY ONE we talked, all 5  times failed to put the correct # in the system and had not reached out to our insured about delivery.  This family went through a hurricane and XPO Logistics had their mattress for 3 plus weeks and failed to contact my customer and when I called I was told the 1st available delivery was 2 weeks out.  I explained this was not acceptable as we had given them the contact # 5 times and they failed to contact them.  I asked for a manager and was told the only way to contact them was by email (as it seems they send their customer service off-shore).  I gave Mal (XPO rep) my person cell # as I would not be in the office at 8 pm and needed this resolved.  NO CALL.  I called the next day and got the same story from Cissel and guess what NO CALL.  This company has horrible customer service and if you are a business who uses them to ship your product I would think twice as the customers on this side are receiving very poor service.

name: Cary Ward
text: Unprofessional drivers with idaf attitudes and the office personnel aren't any better. Absolutely no follow-up on trying to file a damage claim, that's where the low rating on the driver in a rush and " didn't know how to list it" on the bill of lading.

name: Richard Patino
text: Good service

name: Ciochina Adriana
text: Worst experience to deal with brokers, my truck was sitting for 2 days,because their appt was 2 days later than the one on the rate conf, they did not do anything, just made us wait for the appt to give us  $150/day (for reefer to hold their product and to pay driver).No manager helped, they didn’t care that we are sitting and that they are paying us this amount for a reefer load.They have  many fines for the carrier, but they pay $150 layover.Did a short run for California to AZ, 4 days for 360 miles, for 2 days 300$ layover for a reefer.When they unloaded my truck it took like 8h, they told me detention is paid after 60 days.Terrible job, the broker is Richard Atkins and his team.Please stay away from this kind of loads and brokers if you’re not trying to loose money  and your time.

name: Stepan Dimoglo
text: They don't reply to the emails

name: Derek Stephens
text: Great company

name: Lakendra Smith
text: Every time my packages are delivered from this location my packages ALWAYS go the wrong address. They need to make sure these drivers are reading the correct and whole addresses. People would like to actually receive their packages. This only happens with FEDEX. This has happened to me on 4 different occasions. It showed my package was delivered but it’s not where to be found. This is a VERY VERY big inconvenience and poor customer service. I’m sure they don’t send their packages to someone else’s house. If I could chose what mail carriers could deliver my mail it SURE WOULDN’T be FEDEX not this location anyway. DEFINITELY DISAPPOINTED!!!!!!

name: Nikki Wilcox
text:
Looking for a good lawyer to represent all the customers that this place has stolen packages from.
Please help!

name: Michelle Wood-Capolino
text: Too often I have to chase down my deliveries. They don't even get it to the right street or building,  let alone apartment.  And trying to contact the local hubs is next to impossible.

name: Mark Winslow
text: out in the middle of no-where but they were very helpful

name: Steven Dyess
text:
Any package that goes to the Eastaboga, AL office is likely to be lost forever. I placed an order with a well known retailer 3 weeks ago and the driver left it at a house in different zip code. The retailer sent it a second time and I just got a notice that the delivery failed because no one was at home. I've been here all day, so he either went to the wrong house again or just lied about it. Calling FedEx will get you someone in India who can do nothing but write a report.

FedEx stands all alone as the worst company on earth.

name: Richard Mannick
text: I can't believe that a business like this only has one scanner and it's broke HOW do you run a business?????? Then I call customer service and they send me to places like Dollar General and they don't know nothing. But when you get send all over town by the service they provide and you can't even get a label printed and ship a package something is really WRONG. Don't know Want be doing business with FEDEX ANY MORE.

name: Heimdall's Gate
text: Great service for everyone else except me ... Unfortunately I went to the wrong store.

name: Anitra Davis
text: Waited 45 minutes during regular business hours to ship a package... made it all the way home n. They finally answered n said they was open but locked the doors bc a staff member had to leave. Went back still had to go to a different location the lady upfront didn’t know how to work the scanner to give back a receipt 9/22/20

name: Trevor Grubbs
text: This place is the worst! Package sat on a truck to be delivered for (5) days! No delivery date could be confirmed.  Got fed up and ordered from another company that doesn't ship with FedEx, of course! This Eastaboga location seems to be incompetent and the 1 800 # is no help. Done with FedEx!

name: Hunter Webster
text: Poor customer service from the lady in the front VERY RUDE. Will start using another location or ups.

name: elaine garduno
text: Waited twenty mins in the front no one came out

name: Christine Wilson
text: Delivery driver left my package 2 doors down from me today. Drivers from this location have been here several times so I don't understand why they left it at someone else's home. There is a sign on top of the mailbox with the address number on it. If I hadn't been watching for it I wouldn't have gotten my package.

name: Gene Peppers
text: I want my packages that are disappearing!!! I’m going to report you to the police for THEFT

name: Johnny Carmicheal
text: I thought the store was well ran and very friendly I would recommend it to anyone.

name: Deidra Milliner
text: Customer service rep.

name: Little Big Truths
text: Place is as scammy as they come! One of our packages has been delivered to wrong address and one of our neighbors brought it over. Second time, the driver scanned the product as delivered, but it never made it to our place. Basically, the driver either delivered it to the worn house again or flat out stile it. I’d wager it was stolen. We filed complaints, but nothing was investigated or reimbursed to us. Here’s reason why I’m inclined to believe that our second package was stolen - we forced them to deliver correctly was when we included a request to have package released under signature upon delivery. So driver knows where our place is and where to deliver... Now every time we order anything shipped, we specifically request NOT to ship items with FedEx...

name: Andrew Dunscombe
text: Friendly and helpful experience

name: David Anderson
text: They lied about attempting to deliver. I was sitting at home when I got a “missed you” text

name: Carmen C Yates
text: I’ve had two Fedex packages delivered this week. BOTH ladies were excellent! I didn’t get the first lady’s name, but the second was Tria Sellers. Thank you for taking great care of my packages & making sure I received them!

name: TJ Redrock
text: I can see why all the negative reviews. I had package scheduled to be delivered to our office and everything was on time until I got a delivery exception notification. It claimed that our business was close, which was not the case. We are under construction, but have very, very clear signs on directing traffic. Giving the benefit of the doubt, I called Fedex to let them know I need that pack THE DAY IT WAS SCHEDULED and that THEIR DRIVER is the one that failed to read clearly marked signs on where to deliver it. Neither UPS or USPS and any issues delivering. They sent the local hub the message that we needed the package that day. I scheduled this 15 mins after I got the delivery exception. The driver couldn't have been very far away at this time. After 5 o'clock I called again and basically said that they were not delivering it and that I could not pick it up until the next day. If I needed it the next day, that's when I would have scheduled the delivery. FedEx basically told me they don't care that it was their fault my package wasn't in my hand and they weren't going to do anything about it. Talk about great customer service. If you can, stick with UPS or even USPS if you want your package on time.

name: Lindy Alverson
text: If I could give no stars, I would. My package has been at the facility since Wednesday and it is now Saturday night. Everyday I receive an email in the morning that my package is out for delivery and every evening I receive an email that no delivery was attempted. I tried to call and the customer rep hung up on me. Horrible place!

name: M.D. Harrell
text: I missed a delivery and then drove 45 mins to this FedEx facility so that I could pick-up my package.  The facilities customer service operations stop at 6pm, but the driver wasn't going to be back until after 6.  The gentleman working the customer service center offered for me to wait in my vehicle until the driver returned and then he would come get me.  I received my package at about 6:15 and was able to head home very satisfied.

name: Tim Flood
text: HAL package quickly staged upon my arrival, great security and communications. Fantastic experience.

name: Sandra Simpson
text: as far as  the people  or drives r really nice  that bring you orders  to your house  i would gave them a `10 . now the man in my area for pick up  a 000 he will tell you go to the area where there is a store for you to drop it  and he will pick it up there

name: Vicky Li
text: Horrible! I was waiting all day for my package by my door! Didn’t even come by and said “delivery exception”. The truck did not even come to my house yet they flat out lie and say I was not home when I obviously was!! They are the worst!!!

name: Matthew Sweeney
text: FedEx is probably the worst shipping company in the world. If dudes in India can hand-deliver millions of lunches every day without getting anything wrong, a US company could at least have a functional website or a delivery schedule that accounts for people who work for a living.

text: Come to the door, already have their hang-tag filled out, tap once and high-tail to the truck and leave. Supposedly they will deliver on Saturday but will not even if the package was shipped with Saturday Delivery paid for....... Always the same...NEVER deliver on time.

text: Fed X 800 number is no help. You can't get in touch with the local office to ask a SIMPLE QUESTION. This is not really good business.  Can't say anything about the local office as I could not speak to anyone there.

name: Vicky Caldwell
text: Good price and service

name: Melissa Moore
text: If I could go lower than a 1, I definitely would! I have never had an accurate delivery come from this facility. It's like their drivers can't follow simple instructions. I mean, why would you try and deliver a sign for package outside of the specific instructions saying what times someone will be available to sign

name: Billy Voluntarist Burger
text: Next day delivery. Yeah right! Got jacked around. My account has had specific instructions to leave all packages on front porch if no one is home. Called customer service several times. I got several different stories from several different people as to why package was not left. I was told I could drive 50 miles to pickup at the ship center on Saturday or wait until Monday for re-delivery. Then I was told that the shipper could request Saturday delivery. I conference the the shipper and Fed-ex and shipper provided account number for Saturday delivery. After being on the phone and talking to 4-5 diffrent people over a 2 hour period, I finally was told by a supervisor that the fed-ex ship center where my package was being held, was not even open on Saturday.REALLY? So due to thier incompetence not only will I not get my "next day package" on time, but when I do finally get the shipment, it will be useless to me. I guess I'm lucky I called back enough times to finally figure out that the ship-center was not open Saturdays, before I made a 100 mile round trip for nothing. Do not use Fed-ex if you need to get your packages delivered on-time. They cannot follow shipping instructions and are incompetent.

name: Zack Robertson
text: Sat at home ALL DAY waiting for a delivery that would be here "before 8 PM". Walk outside to get something out of my truck and notice a tag hanging on the door. The driver didn't even attempt to ring the door bell or knock to where I could hear the door, and I only missed the delivery by 2 minutes. Tried to get in touch with someone from this facility to find out where the driver was, because I knew he had to be in my vicinity, only to be directed to some call center overseas where they didn't have any helpful information. If I could give zero stars, I would. Piss poor performance from this location.

text: Worst delivery I ever had ordered a car part I need for my only vehicle it was supposed to be delivered on the 11th they rescheduled it to the 15th and on the 15th I get a delivery’s exception for inspection worst company by far!!

text:
wish I could give them a 0
Waiting on a delivery for days, I even took a day off work to wait...when I checked online later that day, they had updated it saying they couldn't deliver because I wasn't home.. really bad service

name: Ken Davenport
text:
Several times on critical overnight or next day packages have not received them on time. Have received them as promised about half the time.  This FedEx location has terrible logistics. That is complicated by the fact that you cannot contact that place directly. So everytime I call I get someone in a central location who tells me that the bozo has "put it on the wrong van". So I had to cancel plans twice to stay in town to get the packages. Will not use FedEx again. Unfortunately the shipper use FedEx. They have not arrived at the same conclusion I have yet but they will with time

Update 3months later....ok so since then I've had 4 more packages shipped with Fed Sux. One an expensive cello...arrived as promised. The other 3 ...DAYS late! It's unbelievable!!! UPS is killing FedSux. I get daily deliveries from UPS and you can bet your first born it will be delivered on the day it's promised

name: Angela Herring
text: Horrible customer service!.  My mom waited at my house ALL DAY for a package that they delivered around 6:00.  I was there just before 6:00 and never saw them.  I wonder if they even knocked!  Use UPS instead!

name: Maria Newbold
text: I had to drive about 30 min drive from my home to Eastabogo fedx location. My husband and I got there a little bit before 6pm (closing) time. We were surprised that the doors were lock because it was not 6pm. My husband knock on the door because the office inside light was on. I called the 800 number to see why the location closed early. The first customer service representative assistant that the location did not have a number. I hung up the phone and called again; the next customer rep was nice and she contact the location to see why the doors were closed before 6pm. Customer service rep stated that Jenny said that she was assisting another customer and she lock the door at 6pm. While i was on the phone with the customer rep the lady, Jenny, came to the door. She open the door half way and got my recipt and allowed me to come in the building. She stated to me that she lock the door at 6pm..i told her she didnt while still on the phone with fedx customer rep...the lady Jenny handed me back my reciept and told me I can get my package tommorrow. Customer service suck and that lady need to be fired.

text: I went into Micheal's around 5pm after work to pick up a package at the UPS access point. The line at the register was long with only one cashier. I don't remember the lady's name, but regardless of the heavy volume she greeted each customer with a smile. She worked as quickly and efficiently as possible to clear every one. I work in retail also so I understand the pressure at times, and she handled it gracefully.

resp.text: Thank you for the rating! We appreciate your positive rating for this UPS location.

text: Thier location might be ok but the employees are bot so kind nor proffesional. This company truly needs to really improve the service. The rude employees need to learn how to do a better job and how to treat the public better.

resp.text: We apologize your experience at this location did not meet your expectations. Your feedback will help us improve your future experience. If you need further assistance from UPS, please contact us with your information via a Private Message or Direct Message on one of our social channels: Facebook @UPS or Twitter @UPSHelp.

name: Lauren Vernon
text: I wish I could give 0 stars. Their delivery driver propped a 70 pound gun safe on my garage door. He/she did not knock to let us know where it was. When we opened the garage door it fell on my car!!! Now my car and the gun safe are damaged. To make matters even worse, they are currently ignoring my husband’s phone calls. Corporate said it was their responsibility to pay for the damages, but apparently the local office doesn’t seem to think so. Now I have another package to be delivered by them soon, and I am dreading it. I would purposely not order from any company that uses them if I could figure that information out.

name: Ethan R
text: I guess we're just leaving things on the side of the road now.

name: Kimberly Smith
text:
A pure nightmare! Ordered lawnmower on walmart.com with 2 day delivery. Ordered Fri morning and was given delivery date of Monday. Monday morning at 6:08am, the package was scanned at Birmingham facility and "Out for Delivery" by the end of the day on Monday. Waited for package all day. Approx 7pm, status went from "out for delivery" to "pending". Started
calling for updates beginning Tuesday morning and package just seem to have disappeared. Customer service is obviously in another country and they can't tell me anything. It's Thursday now and still no package OR delivery date. I've offered to go pick it up and was told I didn't have that option. So my $300 paid in full lawnmower is no where to be found and I'm told I "just need to be patient". Who are they to decide when they want to deliver??? I will never use FedEx again nor will I order from any company that uses this carrier.

name: L&S Taylor
text: If I could give it no stars I would. This is the worst place ever. Package suppose be delivered on Monday here it is Thursday and still no package and this was multiple gifts for a Christmas party tomorrow. Even paid for express shipping. Still haven’t received the packages and was lied to when I called them. They stated the company put it for standard delivery and I had the company we purchased for on the other end of the phone that stated no they did not. It was sent express delivery and Belk had sent me the proof. Fedex phone rep still continued to lie on Belk. Then when told we were recording the conversation and wanted to see proof that Belk had sent the shipment out for standard 5-7 day delivery as he told us and have it emailed for documentation purposes he hung up because he knew he was caught in his own web of lies. On top of that, it shows the package has been at the Birmingham facility since the 10th and yet still hasn’t been delivered. The second package shows it is in Georgia and has been for 2 days with no movement. The rep said nobody would answer the phones at the Georgia facility in Kennesaw as well as this Birmingham facility so he couldnt speak with them about why the packages hasn’t moved or been delivered. This place is a total joke and fraud. They charge you for express shipping and never do it. That is the same as stealing from people. They take your money and then do not deliver. Horrible!
